intro: Boechera howellii, commonly known as Howell's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded seed pods that disperse its seeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
